quote: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Out beyond ideas of wrong doing and right doing there is a field. I'll meet you there. When the soul lies down in that grass the world is too full to talk about.

quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul
author: Victor Hugo

quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.

quote: I have never found anybody who could stand to accept the daily demonstrative love I feel in me, and give back as good as I give.

quote: The best things in life make you sweaty.

quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.

quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together,but do so with all your heart.

quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.

quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.

quote: To die will be an awfully big adventure.

quote: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.

quote: I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.

quote: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.

quote: What greater gift than the love of a cat.

quote: I know you're tired but come, this is the way.

quote: If I love you, what business is it of yours?

quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

quote: The heart was made to be broken.

quote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.

quote: Yet each man kills the thing he lovesBy each let this be heardSome do it with a bitter lookSome with a flattering wordThe coward does it with a kissThe brave man with a sword
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I love mankind, he said, "but I find to my amazement that the more I love mankind as a whole, the less I love man in particular.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear.

quote: If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to be; and if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger.

quote: The most painful thing is losing yourself in the process of loving someone too much, and forgetting that you are special too.

quote: Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.

quote: The great thing to remember is that though our feelings come and go God's love for us does not.

quote: All my heart is yours, sir: it belongs to you; and with you it would remain, were fate to exile the rest of me from your presence forever.

quote: It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done.

quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.

quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books

quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

quote: I almost wish we were butterflies and liv'd but three summer days - three such days with you I could fill with more delight than fifty common years could ever contain.

reference: Bright Star: Love Letters and Poems of John Keats to Fanny Brawne

quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.

quote: One ought to hold on to one's heart; for if one lets it go, one soon loses control of the head too.

quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.

quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.

quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.

quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.

quote: If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.

quote: Good night, good night! parting is such sweet sorrow, That I shall say good night till it be morrow.

quote: Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence.

quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.

quote: If you can make a woman laugh, you can make her do anything.

quote: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.

reference: The Importance of Being Earnest and Other Plays

quote: The soul is healed by being with children.

quote: Do not swear by the moon, for she changes constantly. then your love would also change.

quote: Thatâ€™s love: Two lonely persons keep each other safe and touch each other and talk to each other.

quote: I wish you to know that you have been the last dream of my soul.

quote: â€ŽAnd yet I have had the weakness, and have still the weakness, to wish you to know with what a sudden mastery you kindled me, heap of ashes that I am, into fire.

quote: The heart can think of no devotionGreater than being shore to the ocean-Holding the curve of one position,Counting an endless repetition.

quote: If you love me as you say you do,' she whispered, 'make it so that I am at peace.

quote: I have so much in me, and the feeling for her absorbs it all; I have so much, and without her it all comes to nothing.

quote: Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.

quote: Voici mon secret. Il est trÃ¨s simple: on ne voit bien qu'avec le cÅ“ur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.

quote: Sweets to the sweet.

quote: The saddest thing about love, Joe, is that not only the love cannot last forever, but even the heartbreak is soon forgotten.

quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love:Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

reference: Demian. Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

quote: It's hard to love a woman and do anything.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God turns you from one feeling to another and teaches by means of opposites so that you will have two wings to fly, not one
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.]

quote: The only way of knowing a person is to love them without hope.

quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination.

quote: Love Jo all your days, if you choose, but don't let it spoil you, for it's wicked to throw away so many good gifts because you can't have the one you want.

quote: To wish was to hope, and to hope was to expect
author: Jane Austen

quote: After all, my erstwhile dear,My no longer cherished,Need we say it was not love,Just because it perished?
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Itâ€™s hard to communicate anything exactly and thatâ€™s why perfect relationships between people are difficult to find.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: I am beginning to understand," said the little prince. "There is a flower... I think that she has tamed me...
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.

quote: And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.

quote: For she had eyes and chose me.

quote: Hearts Live By Being Wounded

quote: There is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person, however dear and beloved, but an expansion, an interpretation, of one's self, the very meaning of one's soul.

quote: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination.

quote: Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.

quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.

quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

quote: What you are to do without me I cannot imagine.

quote: In God there is no hunger that needs to be filled, only plenteousness that desires to give.

quote: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.

quote: May I kiss you then? On this miserable paper? I might as well open the window and kiss the night air.

quote: Love, that moves the sun and the other stars
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.

quote: A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.

quote: Was it the infinite sadness of her eyes that drew him or the mirror of himself that he found in the gorgeous clarity of her mind?

quote: The Artist always has the masters in his eyes.

quote: Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal.

quote: Live to the point of tears.

quote: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.

quote: Soul meets soul on lovers lips.

quote: No man is offended by another man's admiration of the woman he loves it is the woman only who can make it a torment.

reference: The Letters of Vincent van Gogh

quote: True love is born from understanding.

quote: If in thirst you drink water from a cup, you see God in it. Those who are not in love with God will see only their own faces in it.

quote: The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity.

quote: You see," she concluded miserably, "when I can call like that to him across space--I belong to him. He doesn't love me--he never will--but I belong to him.

quote: Love, too, has to be learned.

quote: Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Soul, if you want to learn secrets,â€¨your heart must forget about shameâ€¨ and dignity. You are God's lover,â€¨yet you worry what people are saying.

quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank
reference: Anne Frank's Tales from the Secret Annex

quote: I pray you, do not fall in love with me, for I am falser than vows made in wine.

quote: Love is the only future God offers.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There is peace even in the storm
author: Vincent van Gogh
reference: The Letters of Vincent van Gogh

quote: He looked at her as a man might look at a faded flower he had plucked, in which it was difficult for him to trace the beauty that had made him pick and so destroy it
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Ah, when to the heart of man Was it ever less than a treason To go with the drift of things, To yield with a grace to reason, And bow and accept the end Of a love or a season?

quote: To say goodbye is to die a little.

quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.

reference: The Concept of Anxiety: A Simple Psychologically Orienting Deliberation on the Dogmatic Issue of Hereditary Sin

quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ...
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.

quote: Life ... is a taleTold by an idiot, full of sound and fury,Signifying nothing.

quote: If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.

quote: After all, tomorrow is another day!
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: The meaning of life is that it stops.

quote: I wonder why I don't go to bed and go to sleep. But then it would be tomorrow, so I decide that no matter how tired, no matter how incoherent I am, I can skip on hour more of sleep and live.

quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.

quote: In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.

quote: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.

quote: Life is worth living as long as there's a laugh in it.

quote: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.

quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.

quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.

quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.

quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?

quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.

quote: Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Even for me life had its gleams of sunshine.

quote: To look life in the face, always, to look life in the face, and to know it for what it is...at last, to love it for what it is, and then, to put it away...
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.

quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I have no idea what's awaiting me, or what will happen when this all ends. For the moment I know this: there are sick people and they need curing.
author: Albert Camus

quote: To travel is to live.

reference: The Fairy Tale of My Life: An Autobiography

quote: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.

quote: Earth's crammed with heaven...But only he who sees, takes off his shoes.

quote: The human race tends to remember the abuses to which it has been subjected rather than the endearments. What's left of kisses? Wounds, however, leave scars.

quote: No single event can awaken within us a stranger whose existence we had never suspected. To live is to be slowly born.

quote: The beautiful is always bizarre.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five.

quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.

quote: Hardships make or break people.

quote: Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good.

quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.

quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Without music, life would be a blank to me.
author: Jane Austen

quote: ...when pain is over, the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure.
author: Jane Austen

quote: It might be possible that the world itself is without meaning.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: To regret oneâ€™s own experiences is to arrest oneâ€™s own development. To deny oneâ€™s own experiences is to put a lie into the lips of oneâ€™s own life. It is no less than a denial of the soul.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Never compete with someone who has nothing to lose.
author: Baltasar Gracián

quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.
author: Albert Camus
reference: The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays

quote: We know from daily life that we exist for other people first of all, for whose smiles and well-being our own happiness depends.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: At 50, everyone has the face he deserves.
author: George Orwell

quote: He is terribly afraid of dying because he hasnâ€™t yet lived.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: All I am is literature, and I am not able or willing to be anything else.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float,To gain all while you give,To roam the roads of lands remote,To travel is to live.
author: Hans Christian Andersen
reference: The Fairy Tale of My Life: An Autobiography

quote: A man is like a novel: until the very last page you don't know how it will end. Otherwise it wouldn't even be worth reading.

quote: If we admit that human life can be ruled by reason, then all possibility of life is destroyed.

quote: Now and then we had a hope that if we lived and were good, God would permit us to be pirates.

quote: This place is a dream. Only a sleeper considers it real. Then death comes like dawn, and you wake up laughing at what you thought was your grief.

quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;Behind the clouds is the sun still shining;Thy fate is the common fate of all,Into each life some rain must fall
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: When you compare the sorrows of real life to the pleasures of the imaginary one, you will never want to live again, only to dream forever.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing.

quote: When all is said and done, the life of faith is nothing if not an unending struggle of the spirit with every available weapon against the flesh.

quote: All our knowledge has its origin in our perceptions

quote: Ah, Nothing is too late, till the tired heart shall cease to palpitate.

quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.

quote: Make the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you.

quote: Shallow men believe in luck or in circumstance. Strong men believe in cause and effect.

quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.

quote: I've had a lot of worries in my life, most of which never happened.

quote: Most people die with their music still locked up inside them.

quote: Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.

quote: When I hear music, I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times, and to the latest.

quote: Man cannot possess anything as long as he fears death. But to him who does not fear it, everything belongs. If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself.

quote: Write while the heat is in you. The writer who postpones the recording of his thoughts uses an iron which has cooled to burn a hole with. He cannot inflame the minds of his audience.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I wonder,â€ he said, â€œwhether the stars are set alight in heaven so that one day each one of us may find his own again...

quote: Of all the wonders that I have heard,It seems to me most strange that men should fear;Seeing death, a necessary end,Will come when it will come.(Act II, Scene 2)

quote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.

quote: The truth was a mirror in the hands of God. It fell, and broke into pieces. Everybody took a piece of it, and they looked at it and thought they had the truth.

quote: Achievement has no color

quote: When people see some things as beautiful,other things become ugly.When people see some things as good,other things become bad.

quote: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.

quote: I wish I could make him understand that a loving good heart is riches enough, and that without it intellect is poverty.

quote: Do not give way to useless alarm; though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain.

quote: Day after day, day after day,We stuck, nor breath nor motion;As idle as a painted shipUpon a painted ocean.

reference: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

quote: I don't know, I don't want to talk as much. (...) It's nicer to think dear, pretty thoughts and keep them in one's heart, like treasures. I don't like to have them laughed at or wondered over.

quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.

quote: If people reach perfection they vanish, you know.

quote: Give your weakness to one who helps.

quote: Every person has a right to risk their own life for the preservation of it.

quote: Small is the number of them that see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts.

quote: We have to pray with our eyes on God, not on the difficulties.

quote: If there is anything that links the human to the divine, it is the courage to stand by a principle when everybody else rejects it.

quote: I wanted change and excitement and to shoot off in all directions myself, like the colored arrows from a Fourth of July rocket.

quote: I held my heart back from positively accepting anything, since I was afraid of another fall, and in this condition of suspense I was being all the more killed.

quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.

quote: The question is not how to get cured, but how to live.

quote: My love is something valuable to me which I ought not to throw away without reflection.

quote: There is no illusion greater than fear.

quote: And a beautiful world we live in, when it is possible, and when many other such things are possible, and not only possible, but done-- done, see you!-- under that sky there, every day.

quote: Inspiration comes of working every day.

quote: Dancing in all its forms cannot be excluded from the curriculum of all noble education; dancing with the feet, with ideas, with words, and, need I add that one must also be able to dance with the pen?

quote: One must work and dare if one really wants to live.

quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quite alone with the heavens, nature and God.

reference: The Diary of a Young Girl

quote: In my deepest wound I saw your glory, and it dazzled me.

quote: I've learned one thing: you can only really get to know a person after a row. Only then can you judge their true character!

reference: The Diary of a Young Girl

quote: Do your work, then step back. The only path to serenity.

quote: The little things of life, sweet and excellent in their place, must not be the things lived for; the highest must be sought and followed; the life of heaven must be begun here on earth.

quote: When he shall die,Take him and cut him out in little stars,And he will make the face of heaven so fineThat all the world will be in love with nightAnd pay no worship to the garish sun.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.

quote: For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.

quote: La tristesse durera toujours.]
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Kill me, or you are a murderer.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: The man who kills a man kills a man.The man who kills himself kills all men.As far as he is concerned, he wipes out the world.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Death walks faster than the wind and never returns what he has taken.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Lord help my poor soul.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: One pain is lessened by anotherâ€™s anguish. ... Take thou some new infection to thy eye, And the rank poison of the old will die.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Better was it to go unknown and leave behind you an arch, then to burn like a meteor and leave no dust.

quote: Woe, destruction, ruin, and decay; the worst is death and death will have his day.

quote: The cemetery is an open space among the ruins, covered in winter with violets and daisies. It might make one in love with death, to think that one should be buried in so sweet a place.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Darkling I listen; and, for many a timeI have been half in love with easeful Death...
author: John Keats

quote: For he who lives more lives than one more deaths than one must die.

reference: The Ballad of Reading Gaol and Other Poems

quote: For while directly we say that it [the length of human life] is ages long, we are reminded that it is briefer than the fall of a rose leaf to the ground.

quote: My wallpaper and I are fighting a duel to the death. One or the other of us has to go.

quote: I wonder if it hurts to live,And if they have to try,And whether, could they choose between,They would not rather die.

quote: That we must all die, we always knew; I wish I had remembered it sooner.

quote: Are we so made that we have to take death in small doses daily or we could not go on with the business of living?

quote: Every blade in the field - Every leaf in the forest - lays down its life in its season as beautifully as it was taken up.

quote: Sin, death, and hell have set their marks on him,And all their ministers attend on him.

quote: Copulation is no more foul to me than death is.
author: Walt Whitman
reference: Leaves of Grass: The First (1855) Edition

quote: Sometimes the dying live more fiercely and wisely than the rest of us. (146)

quote: Now comes the mystery! (last words)
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: We are all the fools of time and terror: DaysSteal on us and steal from us; yet we live,Loathing our life, and dreading still to die.
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: Not easy to state the change you made.If I'm alive now, I was dead,Though, like a stone, unbothered by it.

quote: I've never wished a man dead, but I have read some obituaries with great pleasure.

quote: The many men, so beautiful!And they all dead did lie:And a thousand thousand slimy thingsLived on; and so did I.

reference: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

quote: When along the pavement,Palpitating flames of life,People flicker around me,I forget my bereavement,The gap in the great constellation,The place where a star used to be
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: true apothecary thy drugs art quick
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The past attracts me, the present frightens me, because the future is death.
author: Guy de Maupassant
reference: The Complete Short Stories of Guy de Maupassant, Part One

quote: It wasn't his, it wasn't my fault,we both had nothing except patience,but Death has none. I saw him come (how meanly!)and I watched him as he took and took:none of it I could claim as mine.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: It is not because other people are dead that our affection for them grows faint, it is because we ourselves are dying.

quote: Neither of the two people in the room paid any attention to the way I came in, although only one of them was dead.

quote: Everything ends in death, everything. Death is terrible.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: O, pardon me, thou bleeding piece of earth, / That I am meek and gentle with these butchers!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The rest, is silence.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nothing, they say is more certain than death, and nothing more uncertain than the time of dying
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: But thoughts the slave of life, and life, Timeâ€™s fool,And Time, that takes survey of all the world,Must have a stop.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The bustle in a houseThe morning after deathIs solemnest of industriesEnacted upon earth,--The sweeping up the heart,And putting love awayWe shall not want to use againUntil eternity
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Death is the true inspiring genius, or the muse of philosophy, wherefore Socrates has defined the latter as Î¸Î±Î½á½±Ï„Î¿Ï… Î¼ÎµÎ»á½³Ï„Î·. Indeed without death men would scarcely philosophise.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer
reference: The World as Will and Representation, Vol 1

quote: The world is too brutal for me-I am glad there is such a thing as the grave-I am sure I shall never have any rest till I get there.
author: John Keats

quote: God forgive me everything!â€™ she said, feeling the impossibility of struggling...
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death is woven in with the violets,â€ said Louis. â€œDeath and again death.â€)
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: When shall I be dead and rid Of all the wrong my father did? How long, how long 'till spade and hearse Put to sleep my mother's curse?
author: T.H. White

quote: Let us endeavor so to live that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.

quote: The final reward of the dead - to die no more
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Quaff, oh quaff this kind nepenthe, and forget this lost Lenore!
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Civilized society is perpetually menaced with disintegration through this primary hostility of men towards one another.

quote: The night sky is only a sort of carbon paper,Blueblack, with the much-poked periods of starsLetting in the light, peephole after peephole--- A bonewhite light, like death, behind all things.

quote: How we keep these dead souls in our hearts. Each one of us carries within himself his necropolis.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Once you are born in this world youâ€™re old enough to die.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: And what does it mean -- dying? Perhaps man has a hundred senses, and only the five we know are lost at death, while the other ninety-five remain alive.

quote: O weep for Adonis - He is dead." "Peace. He is not dead he doth not sleep - he hath wakened from the dream of life
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The only certainty is death.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: I am forever walking upon these shores,Betwixt the sand and the foam,The high tide will erase my food prints,And the wind will blow away the foam,But the sea and the shore will remain forever.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Perfection of character is this: to live each day as if it were your last, without frenzy, without apathy, without pretence.

quote: The day of my birth, my death began its walk. It is walking toward me, without hurrying.

quote: Tell me not in mournful numbers,Life is but an empty dream!For the soul is dead that slumbers,And things are not what they seem.

quote: I see black light (his last words)
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Yes, they are carnal, both of them, love and death, and therein lies their terror and their great magic!

quote: It can't be that life is so senseless and horrible. But if it really has been so horrible and senseless, why must I die and die in agony? There is something wrong!

quote: Ich werde stehen und warten.Ich werde mÃ¼de werden.Ich werde nicht einschlafen.Ich werde sterben.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Either this wallpaper goes, or I do.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There is a certain right by which we many deprive a man of life, but none by which we may deprive him of death; this is mere cruelty.

quote: This feather stirs; she lives! if it be so, it is a chance which does redeem all sorrows that ever I have felt.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: And starward drifts the stricken world,Lone in unalterable gloomDead, with a universe for tomb,Dark, and to vaster darkness whirled.(â€œThe Testimony of the Sunsâ€)
author: George Sterling
reference: The Thirst of Satan: Poems of Fantasy and Terror

quote: Remembrance of things past is just for the rich. For the poor it only marks the faint traces on the path to death.
author: Albert Camus

quote: In the early morning on the lake sitting in the stern of the boat with his father rowing, he felt quite sure that he would never die.

quote: Cordelia! stay a little. Ha! What is't thou say'st? Her voice was ever soft.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Her blood is settled, and her joints are stiff;Life and these lips have long been separated:Death lies on her like an untimely frostUpon the sweetest flower of all the field.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Darkling I listen; and, for many a timeI have been half in love with easeful Death,Call'd him soft names in many a musÃ¨d rhyme,To take into the air my quiet breath.
author: John Keats

quote: Life is a predicament which precedes death.
author: Henry James

quote: Like as the waves make towards the pebbled shore,So do our minutes hasten to their end;Each changing place with that which goes before,In sequent toil all forwards do contend.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Here I am trying to live, or rather, I am trying to teach the death within me how to live.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Because there is nothing here than invites us to cherish unhappy lovers. Nothing is more vain than to die for love. What we ought to do is live.
author: Albert Camus

quote: poor boy! I never knew you, Yet I think I could not refuse this moment to die for you, if that would save you
author: Walt Whitman

quote: My flesh winced, in cowardice, from such a death.

quote: Whatever distinguishes one lump of flesh from another when we're alive, we're all the same once we're dead. Just used-up shells.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
reference: Notes from the Underground & The Gambler

quote: Death is the sanction of everything the story-teller can tell. He has borrowed his authority from death.

quote: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval

quote: Our dead are never dead to us, until we have forgotten them.

quote: Fight on, brave knights! Man dies, but glory lives! Fight on; death is better than defeat! Fight on brave knights! for bright eyes behold your deeds!

quote: Too much of water hast thou, poor Ophelia,And therefore I forbid my tears.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The grave and the image are equally links with the irrecoverable and symbols for the unimaginable.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: You have tasted of death now,â€ said the old man. â€œIs it good?â€ â€œIt is good,â€ said Mossy. â€œIt is better than life.â€â€œNo,â€ said the old man: â€œit is only more life.

quote: These are the ushers of Martius: before himHe carries noise, and behind him he leaves tears.Death, that dark spirit, in's nervy arm doth lie,Which being advanc'd, declines, and then men die.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: How wicked it would be, if we could, to call the dead back! She said not to me but to the chaplain, 'I am at peace with God.' She smiled, but not at me. Poi si torno all' eterna fontana.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Thus let me live, unseen, unknown;Thus unlamented let me die;Steal from the world, and not a stoneTell where I lie.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I grew up in a hospital and as a child I played in the dissecting room

quote: I had traded the fight against love for the fight against loneliness, the fight against life for the fight against death.

quote: We must make haste then, not only because we are daily nearer to death, but also because the conception of things and the understanding of them cease first.

quote: Glory is the sunshine of the dead

quote: This world's a city full of straying streets, and death's the market-place where each one meets.

quote: I had never known any man to die while speaking in terza-rima

quote: The foolish rush to end their lives.Only the steadfast soul survives.

quote: In fact living is dying.

author: William Shakespeare

quote: So long as human beings stay human, death and life are the same thing.

quote: We have long become overgrown with calluses; we no longer hear people being killed. ("X")

quote: The fact of having been born is a bad augury for immortality.

reference: The Life of Reason: Five Volumes in One

quote: ...every human being is doomed to die, which is the greatest of all failures.

quote: [death]...the abyss from where no traveler is permitted to return

quote: It was in the reign of George II. that the above-named personages lived and quarrelled ; good or bad, handsome or ugly, rich or poor, they are all equal now
author: William Makepeace Thackeray
reference: The Memoirs of Barry Lyndon, Esq. written by himself

quote: And the life of the ebony clock went out with that of the last of the gay. And the flames of the tripods expired. And Darkness and Decay and the Red Death held illimitable dominion over all.

reference: The Masque of the Red Death

quote: For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and melt into the sun?
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: That is a dream also; only he has remained asleep, while you have awakened; and who knows which of you is the most fortunate?

quote: La vida es mi tortura y la muerte serÃ¡ mi descanso.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is when we are faced with death that we turn most bookish.

quote: In crime and enmity they lie Who sin and tell us love can die, Who say to us in slander's breath That love belongs to sin and death.

quote: For Brutus, as you know, was Caesar's angel:Judge, O you gods, how dearly Caesar loved him!This was the most unkindest cut of all
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The guillotine is the ultimate expression of Law, and its name is vengeance; it is not neutral, nor does it allow us to remain neutral.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: And will 'a not come again? And will 'a not come again? No, no, he is dead, Go to thy death bed: He will never come again.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Till her appointed course be run;Till on the darkness faint her breathFlown to the silent void, and DeathSit crowned upon the ashen sun.(â€œThe Testimony of the Sunsâ€)
author: George Sterling
reference: The Thirst of Satan: Poems of Fantasy and Terror

quote: Art is long, and Time is fleeting,And our hearts, though stout and brave,Still, like muffled drums, are beatingFuneral marches to the grave.

quote: Are not our lives too short for that full utterance which through all our stammerings is of course our only and abiding intention?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: The back door of every tomb opens on a hilltop.
author: George MacDonald

quote: Never use abstract nouns when concrete ones will do. If you mean â€œMore people diedâ€ donâ€™t say â€œMortality rose.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: For, truly, the man who does not know when to die, does not know how to live.
author: John Ruskin

quote: And when suddenlythe god stopped her and, with anguish in his cry,uttered the words: â€˜He has turned roundâ€™ â€“she comprehended nothing and said softly: â€˜Who?
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The candle glimmers but an hour. The nightLooms in its ancient hunger. Would you knowThe tragedy of human love and need?Gaze on the stars, then on a brother's face!
author: George Sterling
reference: The Thirst of Satan: Poems of Fantasy and Terror

quote: Here be dragons to be slain, here be rich rewards to gain;If we perish in the seeking, why, how small a thing is death!

reference: Demian. Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

quote: No thought is born in me that does not bear the image of death.

quote: He dreamed of funeral love, but dreams crumble and the tomb abides

quote: O my love, my wife!Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breathHath had no power yet upon thy beauty.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Your fear of death is but the trembling of the shepherd when he stands before the king whose hand is to be laid upon him in honour.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Be sure that head and heart were laidIn wisdom down, content to die.Be sure he faced the Starless SkyUnduped, unmurmuring, unafraid.(â€œThe Passing of Bierceâ€)
author: George Sterling
reference: The Thirst of Satan: Poems of Fantasy and Terror

quote: It would kill the past, and when that was dead, he would be free.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The planet's tyrant, dotard Death, had held his gray mirror before them for a moment and shown them the image of things to come.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Why, then, should we ever sink overwhelmed with distress, when life is so soon over, and death is so certain an entrance to happiness â€“ to glory?
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: An aged man is but a paltry thing,A tattered coat upon a stick, unlessSoul clap its hands and sing, and louder singFor every tatter in its mortal dress
author: W.B. Yeats

quote: Yes, King Edward VI lived only a few years, poor boy, but he lived them worthily.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Mais, dans la mort dâ€™un homme, un monde inconnu meurt, et je me demandais quelles Ã©taient les images qui sombraient en lui.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: I was trying to learn to write, commencing with the simplest things, and one of the simplest things of all and the most fundamental is violent death.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: For every death is a simplification of existence for the others, removes the necessity to show gratitude, the obligation to pay visits.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: [Death] is a safety-device because, once Man has fallen, natural immortality would be the one utterly hopeless destiny for him.

quote: A human being needs only a small plot of ground on which to be happy, and even less to lie beneath.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
reference: The Sorrows of Young Werther and Selected Writings

quote: Remember thee? Ay, thou poor ghost, while memory holds a seatin this distracted globe. Remember thee?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love is holy.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: My God,' he gasped, 'you're fun to kiss.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: They say the sky is the same everywhere. Travellers, the shipwrecked, exiles, and the dying draw comfort from the thought[.]
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: There is nothing to save, now all is lost,but a tiny core of stillness in the heartlike the eye of a violet.
author: D.H. Lawrence

quote: I have joyfully done much evil in my life to those who have wished me evil (General Maximus)
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Love what is simple and beautiful. These are the essentials.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
reference: The Tao of Emerson the Tao of Emerson

quote: Never delay kissing a pretty girl or opening a bottle of whiskey.
author: Ernest Hemingway
reference: QUOTABLE HEMINGWAY: An A to Z Glossary of Quotations from Ernest Hemingway

quote: At midnight, in the month of June, I stand beneath the mystic moon.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow worldLike a Colossus; and we petty menWalk under his huge legs, and peep aboutTo find ourselves dishonourable graves.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: One need not be a chamber to be haunted.
author: Emily Dickinson
reference: The Complete Poems of Emily Dickinson

quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I turned silences and nights into words. What was unutterable, I wrote down. I made the whirling world stand still.
author: Arthur Rimbaud
reference: A Season in Hell/The Drunken Boat

quote: Peace is always beautiful.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I discover myself on the verge of a usual mistake.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: It is always fatal to have music or poetry interrupted.
author: George Eliot

quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.

quote: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods,There is a rapture on the lonely shore,There is society, where none intrudes,By the deep sea, and music in its roar:I love not man the less, but Nature more
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I have drunken deep of joy,And I will taste no other wine tonight.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Love consists of this: two solitudes that meet, protect and greet each other.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: I love the silent hour of night,For blissful dreams may then arise,Revealing to my charmed sightWhat may not bless my waking eyes.
author: Anne Brontë
reference: Best Poems of the BrontÃ« Sisters

quote: When you part from your friend, you grieve not;For that which you love most in him may be clearer in his absence, asthe mountain to the climber is clearer from the plain.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheardAre sweeter; therefore, ye soft pipes, play on.
author: John Keats

quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: My candle burns at both ends;It will not last the night;But ah, my foes, and oh, my friends-It gives a lovely light!

quote: PHOSPHORESCENCE. Now there's a word to lift your hat to... to find that phosphorescence, that light within, that's the genius behind poetry.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Lovers find secret placesinside this violent worldwhere they make transactions with beauty.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The way a crowShook down on meThe dust of snowFrom a hemlock treeHas given my heartA change of moodAnd saved some partOf a day I had rued.
author: Robert Frost

quote: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: The rain to the wind said,You push and I'll pelt.'They so smote the garden bedThat the flowers actually knelt,And lay lodged--though not dead.I know how the flowers felt.
author: Robert Frost

quote: O may I join the choir invisibleOf those immortal dead who live againIn minds made better by their presence; liveIn pulses stirred to generosity,In deeds of daring rectitude...
author: George Eliot
