quote: Donâ€™t walk in front of meâ€¦ I may not followDonâ€™t walk behind meâ€¦ I may not leadWalk beside meâ€¦ just be my friend

quote: When twilight drops her curtain down And pins it with a star Remember that you have a friend Though she may wander far.

quote: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?

quote: O friend, for the morrow let us not worryThis moment we have now, let us not hurryWhen our time comes, we shall not tarryWith seven thousand-year-olds, our burden carry
author: Omar Khayyám

quote: Thank goodness, we can choose our friends. We have to take our relatives as they are, and be thankfulâ€¦

quote: I possess the faculty of enjoying the company of those I - of my friends as well in silence as in conversation.

quote: Those friends thou hast, and their adoption tried,Grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel;But do not dull thy palm with entertainmentOf each new-hatch'd, unfledg'd comrade.

quote: Once when I had remarked on the affection quite often found between cat and dog, my friend replied, "Yes. But I bet no dog would ever confess it to the other dogs.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Melly is the only woman friend I ever had,â€ she thought forlornly, â€œthe only woman except Mother who really loved me. Sheâ€™s like Mother, too. Everyone who knew her has clung to her skirts.

quote: Among the tortures and devastations of life is this then-our friends are not able to finish their stories.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: This is my letter to the worldThat never wrote to me

quote: Reprove your friend in secret and praise him in public.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: I am sick to death of cleverness. Everybody is clever nowadays.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: This hand shall never more come near thee with such friendship

quote: I love Humanity but I hate humans

quote: The more she was absolutely in need of external friendship, the more disposed was she to reject it, and to declare to herself that she was prepared to stand alone in the world.

quote: A leader is bestWhen people barely know he existsOf a good leader, who talks little,When his work is done, his aim fulfilled,They will say, â€œWe did this ourselves.

quote: Human nature is like water. It takes the shape of its container.

author: Oscar Wilde

quote: People would rather live in homes regardless of its grayness. There is no place like home.

quote: I did not look for her, because I was afraid of dispelling the mystery we attach to people whom we know only casually.

quote: Conceited people never hear anything but praise.

quote: But one never does form a just idea of anybody beforehand. One takes up a notion and runs away with it.

quote: Pray don't talk to me about the weather, Mr. Worthing. Whenever people talk to me about the weather, I always feel quite certain that they mean something else. And that makes me quite nervous.

quote: History is the essence of innumerable biographies.

quote: Those who are weak don't fight.Those who are stronger might fightfor an hour.Those who are stronger still might fightfor many years.The strongest fighttheir whole life.They are the indispensable ones.

quote: When we have to change an opinion about any one, we charge heavily to his account the inconvenience he thereby causes us.

quote: People who are different from other people are always called peculiar,' said Anne.

quote: It is no use trying to sum people up.

quote: Most people are boring and stupid.

quote: I'd have wasted a lot of time and trouble before I learned that the best way to take all people, black or white, is to take them for what they think they are, then leave them alone.

quote: I love the people,' I said. 'I have room in me for love, and for ever so many little lives.
author: Sylvia Plath
reference: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quote: â€¦having learned that people cannot be moulded like clayâ€¦
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Mankind must put an end to war - or war will put an end to ma
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: In war, our elders may give the orders...but it is the young who have to fight.
author: T.H. White

quote: Your actions speak so loudly, I cannot hear what you are saying.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating- people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing.

quote: It would be unfair to expect other people to be as brilliant as oneself.

quote: Imagination is the only weapon in the war against reality.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: War is only a cowardly escape from the problems of peace.

quote: For America is composed not of two sorts of people, but of two frames of mind - the first engaged in doing what is would like to do, the second pretending that such things do not exist.

quote: Why do we electrocute men for murdering an individual and then pin a purple heart on them for mass slaughter of someone arbitrarily labeled â€œenemy?

quote: Those who lived by the sword were forced to die by it.

quote: Among the many misdeeds of British rule in India, history will look upon the Act which deprived a whole nation of arms as the blackest.

quote: The most disadvantageous peace is better than the most just war.

quote: A lady who sets her heart upon a lad in uniform must prepare to change lovers pretty quickly, or her life will be but a sad one.

quote: Her maternal instinct told her Natasha had too much of something, and because of this she would not be happy
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To be born to create, to love, to win at games is to be born to live in time of peace. But war teaches us to lose everything and become what we were not. It all becomes a question of style.

quote: War is sweet to those who have not experienced it.

quote: All efforts to make politics aesthetic culminate in one thing, war.

quote: In all the useful arts the world is either standing still or going backwards.

quote: Sir, I shall not defeat you - I shall transcend you.

quote: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free

quote: The dead should not rule the living.

quote: There are men running governments who shouldn't be allowed to play with matches.

quote: In conclusion, the arms of others either fall from your back, or they weigh you down, or they bind you fast.

quote: Communism...muat of necessity be a saddening process for anyone who has ever tasted the intellectual pleasures of the world we live in.

quote: One cannot enter a State legislature or a prison for felons without becoming, in some measure, a dubious character.

quote: In politics, you know, as well as I do, there are no men, but ideas - no feelings, but interests.

quote: The senator...was a smart man who had made his way in life with a single-mindedness oblivious to any of those stumbling blocks known as conscience, sworn oaths, justice, duty...

author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The power of love, as the basis of a State, has never been tried.

quote: He is fiddling while Rome is burning, and, unlike the enormous majority of people who do this, fiddling with his face toward the flames.

author: George Orwell

quote: And the drawing near of Death, which alike levels all, alike impresses all with a last revelation, which only an author from the dead could adequately tell.

quote: For you know that any evil spoken of women so generally only hurts those who say it, not women themselves.

quote: People told her she hadn't changed much, in a tone which hinted they were surprised and a little disappointed she hadn't.

quote: I was not one man only but the steady advance hour after hour of an army in close formation, in which there appeared, according to the moment, impassioned men, indifferent men, jealous men.

quote: Sudden shifts and changes are no bad preparation for political life.

quote: Changes ain't totally pleasant but they're excellent things... Two years is about long enough for things to stay exactly the same. If they stayed put any longer they might grow mossy.

quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: True life is lived when tiny changes occur.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Observe always that everything is the result of change, and get used to thinking that there is nothing Nature loves so well as to change existing forms and make new ones like them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: There are times when I am so unlike myself that I might be taken for someone else of an entirely opposite character.

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes.

quote: New and stirring things are belittled because if they are not belittled the humiliating question arises 'Why then are you not taking part in them?

reference: The Selected Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Nothing can be compared to the new life that the discovery of another country provides for a thoughtful person. Although I am still the same I believe to have changed to the bones.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Fashion is everything that goes out of fashion.

quote: This is my thesis: Do you know what is needful to turn an honest man into a rogue! A change of scene--a moment's forgetfulness suffice.

quote: Every change is a menace to stability.

quote: Our minds, like our bodies, are in continual flux; something is hourly lost, and something acquired.

quote: ... To be in time means to change.

quote: The change was made in me; the thing was done. Well or ill done, excusably or inexcusably, it was done.

quote: In the dawn, armed with a burning patience, we shall enter the splendid cities.

quote: Beauty surrounds us.

quote: Your clothes conceal much of your beauty, yet they hide not the unbeautiful.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Beauty is only the start of bearable terror.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: You donâ€™t know what a trial it is to be -like me. I've got to keep my face like steel in the street to keep men from winking at me.

quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: No spring nor summer beauty hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal
author: John Donne
reference: The Complete Poetry and Selected Prose

quote: Many eyes go through the meadow, but few see the flowers in it
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Beauty without expression is boring.

quote: O! she doth teach the torches to burn bright It seems she hangs upon the cheek of night Like a rich jewel in an Ethiop's ear; Beauty too rich for use, for earth too dear.- Romeo -
author: William Shakespeare

quote: She is a peacock in everything but beauty!

quote: Man cannot do without beauty, and this is what our era pretends to want to disregard.

reference: The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays

quote: The beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

quote: BELLADONNA, n. In Italian a beautiful lady; in English a deadly poison. A striking example of the essential identity of the two tongues.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: â€¦for what after all is Youth and Beauty?
author: Jane Austen

quote: We are immensed in beauty, but our eyes have no clear vision.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
reference: The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If ever any beauty I did see,Which I desired, and got, 'twas but a dream of thee.

quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.

quote: All little girls should be told they are pretty, even if they aren't.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.

quote: Strangeness is a necessary ingredient in beauty.

author: Dante Alighieri

author: John Ruskin

author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: Love, built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.

quote: The humblest tasks get beautified if loving hands do them.

quote: The appearance of things changes according to the emotions; and thus we see magic and beauty in them, while the magic and beauty are really in ourselves.

quote: For I have sworn thee fair, and thought thee bright,Who art as black as hell, as dark as night.

quote: If eyes were made for seeing, then beauty is its own excuse for being.

quote: A beautiful woman should break her mirror early.

quote: All kinds of beauty do not inspire love; there is a kind which only pleases the sight, but does not captivate the affections.
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: The Devil hath powerTo assume a pleasing shape.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us, or we find it not.

quote: [This philosophy] â€¦ is antagonistic to minds perverted and crippled by a superhuman

quote: ... the possibility of pain is inherent in the very existence of a world where souls can meet.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: â€¦because it is natural to touch more often the parts that hurt.
author: Seneca

quote: I think you have more fun as a human being even though it is much more painful.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Thus ended the first and adventurous part of his existence. What followed was so different that, but for the reality of sorrow which remained with him, this strange part must have resembled a dream.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: I was overpowered by the mere sensation of that dream and it alone survived in my sorely wounded heart.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
reference: The Dream of a Ridiculous Man

quote: Many families remain for years in the same place, though both husband and wife are sick of it, simply because there is neither complete division nor agreement between them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: [Jo to her mother] I knew there was mischief brewing. I felt it and now it's worse than I imagined. I just wish I could marry Meg myself, and keep her safe in the family.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Well married, a man is winged-ill-matched, he is shackled.
author: Henry Ward Beecher
reference: Norwood: or, Village life in New England

quote: Don't turn your head. Keep looking at the bandaged place. That's where the light enters you.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: So I began to think maybe it was true that when you were married and had children it was like being brainwashed, and afterward you went about as numb as a slave in a totalitarian state.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: I wouldn't want to marry anybody who was wicked, but I think I'd like it if he could be wicked and wouldn't.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: Love seems the swiftest, but it is the slowest of all growths. No man or woman really knows what perfect love is until they have been married a quarter of a century.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Let men tremble to win the hand of woman, unless they win along with it the utmost passion of her heart!
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Like most girls, her imagination carried her just as far as the altar and no further.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: A young man married is a man that's marred.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A woman cannot ever be sure of not being married till she is buried, Mrs. Doctor, dear, and meanwhile I will make a batch of cherry pies.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: With such a worshipping wife, it was hardly possible that any natural defects in it should not be increased. The extreme sweetness of her temper must hurt his.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Do not economize on the hymeneal rites; do not prune them of their splendor, nor split farthings on the day when you are radiant. A wedding is not house-keeping.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy;
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Ahab and aguish lay stretched together in one hammock.
author: Herman Melville

quote: I would rather not be engaged. When people are engaged, they begin to think of being married soon, and I should like everything to go on for a long while just as it is.
author: George Eliot

quote: As far as my experience of matrimony goes -- I think it tends to draw you out of, and away from yourself.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: It will be your duty, and it will be your pleasure too to estimate her (as you chose her) by the qualities that she has, and not by the qualities she may not have.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: I know not which lives more unnatural lives, obeying husbands, or commanding wives.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Luck which so often defies anticipation in matrimonial affairs, giving attraction to what is moderate rather than to what is superior.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.Even as the stone of the fruit must break, that its heart may stand in the sun, so must you know pain.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Oh, sometimes I think it is of no use to make friends. They only go out of your life after a while and leave a hurt that is worse than the emptiness before they came.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Love is an ideal thing, marriage a real thing.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I'll follow this good man, and go with you;And, having sworn truth, ever will be true.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: ... He spoke in the deep tenderness of one about to leave his treasure amid perils and foes, where his remembered words would be the only aid he could bequeath to guide her.
author: Emily Brontë

quote: It was a dark story.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: I assumed my first undivided responsibility.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: It is the most miserable thing to feel ashamed at home.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: I am not only not going to be married, at present, but have very little intention of ever marrying at all.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Here are officers enough in Meryton to disappoint all the young ladies in the country.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Now go with me and with this holy manInto the chantry by: there, before him,And underneath that consecrated roof,Plight me the full assurance of your faith.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I will deny thee nothing: Whereon, I do beseech thee, grant me this, To leave me but a little to myself.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The only thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give is enough love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Music, when soft voices die, vibrates in the memory.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: And the night shall be filled with music, And the cares, that infest the day,Shall fold their tents like the Arabs,and silently steal away.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: There is nothing more to be said or to be done tonight, so hand me over my violin and let us try to forget for half an hour the miserable weather and the still more miserable ways of our fellowmen.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: As the strings of a lute are apart though they quiver the same music.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: A gentleman is someone who knows how to play the banjo and doesn't.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There is no feeling, except the extremes of fear and grief, that does not find relief in music.
author: George Eliot

quote: Next to the Word of God, the noble art of music is the greatest treasure in the world.
author: Martin Luther

quote: ...A strange art â€“ music â€“ the most poetic and precise of all the arts, vague as a dream and precise as algebra.
author: Guy de Maupassant

quote: I see my life in terms of music.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Tax not so bad a voice to slander music any more than once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Music makes one feel so romantic - at least it always gets on one's nerves - which is the same thing nowadays.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: In music the passions enjoy themselves.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: There's a friendly tie of some sort between music and eating.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Music is well said to be the speech of angels; in fact, nothing among the utterances allowed to man is felt to be so divine. It brings us near to the infinite.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Where words fail, music speaks.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Music... will help dissolve your perplexities and purify your character and sensibilities, and in time of care and sorrow, will keep a fountain of joy alive in you.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Music is what tell us that the human race is greater than we realize.
author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quote: Music. A meaningless acceleration in the rhythm of celestial experience.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: If one plays good music, people don't listen, and if one plays bad music people don't talk.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I mentally shake hands with you for your answer, despite its inaccuracy." Mr. Rochester
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs: music is the brandy of the damned. May not one lost soul be permitted to abstain?
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley
reference: Music at Night and Other Essays

quote: If you cannot teach me to fly, teach me to sing.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: Music is the language of the spirit. It opens the secret of life bringing peace, abolishing strife.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: He who sings scares away his woes.
author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

quote: Music fathoms the sky.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: We needed germans in Paris to hear Wagner.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: This mournful and restless sound was a fit accompaniment to my meditations.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Music conveys to us itself!
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: I'm afraid concerts spoil people for everyday life.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: I listen'd, motionless and still;And, as I mounted up the hill,The music in my heart I bore,Long after it was heard no more.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: That innate love of melody, which she had inherited from her ballad-singing mother, gave the simplest music a power which could well-nigh drag her heart out of her bosom at times.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: I do not like the raw sound of the human voice in unison unless it is under the discipline of music.
author: Flannery O'Connor
reference: The Habit of Being: Letters of Flannery O'Connor

quote: Did you hear what I was playing, Lane?I didn't think it polite to listen, sir.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Does notâ€¦ the ear of Handel predict the witchcraft of harmonic sound?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
reference: The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Was he a beast if music could move him so?
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Life without playing music is inconceivable for me. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music, I get most joy in life out of music.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Life exists for the love of music or beautiful things.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: For in music there is no material to be deducted.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Music heals all forms of misery
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: They were making a riotous noise, but it was much more like music - rather advanced music which you don't quite take in at the first hearing - than birds' songs ever are in our world.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Every hidden cell is throbbing with music and life, every fiber thrilling like harp strings.
author: John Muir
reference: The Wilderness World of John Muir

quote: The truth is that there comes a time When we can mourn no more over music That is so much motionless sound
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Next to the Word of God, music deserves the highest praise. The gift of language combined with the gift of song was given to man that he should proclaim the Word of God through Music.
author: Martin Luther

quote: When it happens that I am more moved by the song than the thing which is sung, I confess that I sin in a manner deserving punishment
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: Music that gentlier on the spirit lies,Than tired eyelids upon tired eyes.
author: Alfred Tennyson

quote: He has only heard what I felt.
author: Zora Neale Hurston
reference: How It Feels To Be Colored Me

quote: Music, that is the science or the sense of proper modulation, is likewise given by God's generosity to mortals having rational souls in order to lead them to higher things.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: ...the sole test of music is its power to exalt the soul.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Difficult do you call it, Sir? I wish it were impossible. [on hearing a famous violinist]
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Split the Lark-and you'll find the Music, Bulb after Bulb, in Silver rolled.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Music is essentially useless, as life is.
author: George Santayana

quote: You're broke, eh?I been shaking two nickels together for a month, trying to get them to mate.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: Like all other music, it breathed passion and pathos, and emotions high or tender, in a tongue native to the human heart, wherever educated.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone.Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Simple, genuine goodness is the best capital to found the business of this life upon. It lasts when fame and money fail, and is the only riches we can take out of this world with us.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Suddenly high song awakens me, and I leave all this tedious routine far, far distant; I listen, till all the world is changed, and the beautiful earth becomes more beautiful.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley
reference: Valperga: Or, the Life and Adventures of Castruccio, Prince of Lucca

quote: The gypsies believe the bear to be a brother to man because he has the same body beneath his hide, because he drinks beer, because he enjoys music and because he likes to dance.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Getting money is not all a man's business: to cultivate kindness is a valuable part of the business of life.
author: Samuel Johnson
reference: The Life of Samuel Johnson LL.D. Vol 3

quote: and so I sing, as the Boy does by the Burying Ground â€“ because I am afraid â€“
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: To hear for the duration of a heartbeat the universe and the totality of life in its mysterious, innate harmony.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: No man should receive a dollar unless that dollar has been fairly earned.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Gold conjures up a mist about a man, more destructive of all his old senses and lulling to his feelings than the fumes of charcoal.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Within certain limits, it is actually true that the less money you have, the less you worry.
author: George Orwell
reference: Down and Out in Paris and London

quote: The circulation of confidence is better than the circulation of money.
author: James Madison

quote: There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,Doing more murder in this loathsome world,Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: You can be rich or deliberately refuse to be rich. You can possess money, or you can despise money; the one fatal thing is to worship money and fail to get it
author: George Orwell

quote: Our heart always transcends us.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: He thought that he was sick in his heart if you could be sick in that place.
author: James Joyce
reference: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

quote: I will tear this folly from my heart, though every fibre bleed as I rend it away!
author: Walter Scott

quote: All the knowledge I possess everyone else can acquire, but my heart is all my own.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I wish I had no heart, it aches soâ€¦
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: But the heart has its own memory and I have forgotten nothing.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Oh, well, faint heart never won so much as a scrap of paper
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: I am a fool with a heart but no brains, and you are a fool with brains but no heart; and weâ€™re both unhappy, and we both suffer.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: You can't reason with your heart; it has its own laws, and thumps about things which the intellect scorns.
author: Mark Twain
reference: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

quote: My heart is too thoroughly dried to be broken in a hurry, and I mean to live as long as I can.
author: Anne Brontë

quote: The more often he feels without acting, the less he will be able ever to act, and, in the long run, the less he will be able to feel.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Her heart - like every heart, if only its fallen sides were cleared away - was an inexhaustible fountain of love: she loved everything she saw.
author: George MacDonald
reference: The Day Boy and the Night Girl

quote: The very first tear he made was so deep that I thought it had gone right into my heart.
author: C.S. Lewis
reference: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader

quote: A new heart for a New Year, always!
author: Charles Dickens

quote: And the heart has become so tired, and the longing so vast.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: I have not broken your heart - you have broken it; and in breaking it, you have broken mine.
author: Emily Brontë

quote: A torn jacket is soon mended, but hard words bruise the heart of a child.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: A fool with a heart and no sense is just as unhappy as a fool with sense and no heart.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Doctoring her seemed to her as absurd as putting together the pieces of a broken vase. Her heart was broken. Why would they try to cure her with pills and powders?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If Light Is In Your HeartYou Will Find Your Way Home.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Who has not sat before his own heart's curtain? It lifts: and the scenery is falling apart.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The sorrow that lay cold in her mother's heart... converted it into a tomb.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The heart of a fool is in his mouth, but the mouth of a wise man is in his heart.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I must do something or I shall wear my heart away...
author: Charles Dickens

quote: If your heart is a volcano, how shall you expect flowers to bloom?
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Why did you not forget your heart also? I should never have let you have that back." ...
author: Marcel Proust

quote: It was always once springtime in my heart.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The heart never takes the place of the head: but it can, and should, obey it.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: For though your mind is active enough, your heart is darkened with corruption, and without a pure heart there can be no full or genuine sensibility.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
reference: Notes from Underground, White Nights, The Dream of a Ridiculous Man, and Selections from The House of the Dead

quote: Solitude has soft, silky hands, but with strong fingers it grasps the heart and makes it ache with sorrow.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Love is of all the passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart, and the senses.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: I only knew the schoolbooks said he "died in the wilderness, of a broken heart."More than him has done that," said Antonia sadly, and the girls murmured assent.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Surely once in a life God will grant the earnest entreaty of a loving heart.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley
